text: Ingredients: - 1 small watermelon - 1 small cantaloupe - 1 cup granulated sugar - Juice from 1 lemon - 1 cup water - 1 packet unflavored gelatin - Fresh mint leaves (optional) Instructions: 1.
Cut the watermelon in half and use a spoon to scoop out the flesh, removing any seeds.
Cut the cantaloupe in half, remove the seeds and scoop out the flesh as well. 3.
In a saucepan, combine the granulated sugar, lemon juice, and water.
Heat over medium heat until the sugar has dissolved completely. 4.
Sprinkle the unflavored gelatin over the sugar mixture and whisk until it has completely dissolved. 5.
Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly. 6.
Pour half of the gelatin mixture into each of the melon shells, dividing it evenly between the two. 7.
Cut the watermelon and cantaloupe flesh into small cubes or balls, about 1-inch in size. 8.
Carefully place the watermelon and cantaloupe cubes or balls into the gelatin mixture in the melon shells. 9.
Press the fruit down gently into the gelatin mixture to ensure they are evenly distributed. 10.
Place the filled melon shells in the fridge to set for at least 4 hours, or until the gelatin is firm. 11.
Once the gelatin has set, remove the melon shells from the fridge and carefully cut into slices. 12.
Serve the Two-Melon Terrine slices on a platter, garnished with fresh mint leaves for added freshness, if desired. 13.
Enjoy this refreshing and delicious summer dessert!
Note: You can customize this recipe by adding other fruits to the terrine, such as berries or sliced peaches.
Adjust the sugar and gelatin quantities accordingly if adding more fruit.
